title: OS Level 6 — Virtual Memory & Paging (Advanced)
concept: Demand paging, page faults, TLB, working set, page-replacement and thrashing.

challenges.question: A page fault occurs when:

options.A: The requested page is already in main memory
options.B: The requested page is not in main memory

challenges.explanation: Page faults trigger loading the missing page from secondary storage.

challenges.question: Which of the following page replacement algorithms suffers from Belady's anomaly?
challenges.explanation: FIFO can show more page faults when more frames are allocated.

challenges.question: The working set of a process is:

options.B: Set of pages used in the last Δ time units or references
options.C: Set of pages currently on disk

challenges.explanation: Working set approximates the locality of the process over a recent window.

challenges.question: Which algorithm is commonly used to approximate LRU in hardware/OS?
challenges.explanation: Clock uses a reference bit and circular list to approximate LRU cheaply.

challenges.question: Thrashing is most closely associated with:

options.B: High page-fault rate and low CPU utilization

challenges.explanation: Thrashing leads to continuous paging with little real work, lowering CPU utilization.

challenges.question: Increasing the degree of multiprogramming too much can:

options.B: Cause thrashing if memory is insufficient

challenges.explanation: Too many active processes can exceed physical memory and trigger thrashing.

challenges.question: TLB miss followed by a page hit means:

options.B: Page is in memory but not in TLB
options.C: TLB and memory both lack the page

challenges.explanation: On TLB miss, the OS/page-table lookup finds the page in memory and fills TLB.

challenges.question: Which of the following is TRUE for demand paging?

options.A: All pages of a process are loaded at start
options.B: Pages are loaded only when they are first referenced

challenges.explanation: Demand paging loads pages lazily on first use, not at process start.

challenges.question: Which of the following does the valid/invalid bit in a page table entry indicate?

options.B: Whether the page is present in physical memory

challenges.explanation: Valid/invalid bit marks if the virtual page currently resides in physical memory.

challenges.question: Copy-on-write in virtual memory allows:

options.A: Processes to share pages until one writes, then create a private copy

challenges.explanation: COW optimizes fork and shared pages; write triggers a page fault and copy.
